title: Ferrero makes progress in traceability, recycling initiatives
summary: Ferrero Group increased traceability and recycling while reducing water use in the fiscal year 2022-23. They achieved improved traceability in hazelnut and cocoa supply chains, increased recyclable packaging, and reduced water intensity in manufacturing plants.
green_innovation: TRUE; The article describes how the Ferrero Group has implemented various sustainability measures to reduce negative environmental externalities, thus contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: FALSE; The article primarily focuses on sustainability and environmental initiatives rather than introducing new or significantly improved products or business processes.
green_product: TRUE; The Ferrero Group's efforts to use recyclable, reusable, and compostable materials, reduce plastic in packaging, and source ingredients responsibly align with the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE; The Ferrero Group's implementation of methods and techniques to increase traceability, reduce water use, and promote sustainability in manufacturing processes qualifies as a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311351 - Chocolate and Confectionery Manufacturing from Cacao Beans, 311352 - Confectionery Manufacturing from Purchased Chocolate, 31142 - Fruit and Vegetable Preserving and Specialty Food Manufacturing, 31239 - Other Grocery and Related Product Merchant Wholesalers
greenwashing: FALSE; The article does not suggest any false or misleading claims about the sustainability initiatives of the Ferrero Group, indicating it is not an example of greenwashing.

title: Encouraging businesses to adopt ESG values
summary: The inaugural Star Media Group ESG Positive Impact Awards 2022 recognized 100 companies for driving positive change and inspiring sustainability. The awards highlighted initiatives within environmental, social, and governance aspects and promoted sustainable practices.
green_innovation: TRUE, The article describes initiatives by various companies to drive positive change and embrace sustainability, aligning with green innovation goals.
business_innovation: TRUE, The article mentions companies introducing new initiatives and driving positive change, qualifying as business innovation.
green_product: FALSE, The article primarily focuses on companies' sustainability initiatives and awards, not specifically on individual green products.
green_process: FALSE, The article highlights companies' efforts towards sustainability but does not delve into specific green processes.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 541720 - Research and Development in the Social Sciences and Humanities, 541614 - Process, Physical Distribution, and Logistics Consulting Services, 541330 - Engineering Services, 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
greenwashing: FALSE, The article celebrates genuine sustainability efforts and initiatives by companies, rather than promoting deceptive greenwashing practices.

title: Passionate About Our Planet
summary: Tottenham Hotspur has joined the UN Race to Zero, committing to halve its carbon emissions by 2030 and become net zero carbon by 2040. The Club measured its Scope 3 emissions footprint for the first time in 2022, with fan travel being the most significant source of emissions. They are working towards reducing all emissions towards an ultimate goal of net-zero by 2040.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 711211 - Sports Teams and Clubs, 713940 - Fitness and Recreational Sports Centers, 561599 - All Other Travel Arrangement and Reservation Services, 711310 - Promoters of Performing Arts, Sports, and Similar Events

title: FERRERO GROUP'S 15th SUSTAINABILITY REPORT DEMONSTRATES SOLID PROGRESS AS COMPANY ACCELERATES EFFORTS TO MEET ITS TARGETS
summary: The Ferrero Group has released its 15th Sustainability Report showcasing progress across its sustainability pillars including protecting the environment, responsible sourcing, promoting responsible consumption, and empowering people.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is a green innovation because the Ferrero Group is actively working towards sustainable practices in its value chain, focusing on environmental protection and responsible sourcing.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article focuses on sustainability efforts and progress rather than introducing new products or processes that significantly differ from the firm's previous offerings.
green_product: TRUE. The Ferrero Group is emphasizing sustainable practices in its product design and supply chain management to reduce environmental impact and promote responsible consumption.
green_process: TRUE. The Ferrero Group is implementing green processes in its manufacturing and sourcing activities to minimize environmental impacts, reduce waste, and promote sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311352 - Confectionery Manufacturing from Purchased Chocolate; 311352 - Confectionery Manufacturing from Purchased Chocolate; 311352 - Confectionery Manufacturing from Purchased Chocolate; 311352 - Confectionery Manufacturing from Purchased Chocolate
greenwashing: FALSE. The Ferrero Group's sustainability efforts in the article appear to be genuine and backed by concrete actions, indicating a commitment to environmental responsibility rather than greenwashing.

title: Arushi Rawat
summary: Luxury car OEMs are targeting the emerging market of neo-rich young entrepreneurs in India, influencing the demand for luxury cars in Tier II and Tier III cities.
